ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: In uncertain times, I usually expect the best
Notes: 0= strongly disagree; 1= disagree; 2= neutral; 3= agree; 4= strongly agree

ElementDescription: It's easy for me to relax
Notes: 0= strongly disagree; 1= disagree; 2= neutral; 3= agree; 4= strongly agree

ElementDescription: If something can go wrong for me, it will
Notes: 4= strongly disagree; 3= disagree; 2= neutral; 1= agree; 0= strongly agree

ElementDescription: I'm always optimistic about my future
Notes: 0= strongly disagree; 1= disagree; 2= neutral; 3= agree; 4= strongly agree

ElementDescription: I enjoy my friends a lot
Notes: 0= strongly disagree; 1= disagree; 2= neutral; 3= agree; 4= strongly agree

ElementDescription: It's important for me to keep busy
Notes: 0= strongly disagree; 1= disagree; 2= neutral; 3= agree; 4= strongly agree

ElementDescription: I hardly ever expect things to go my way
Notes: 4= strongly disagree; 3= disagree; 2= neutral; 1= agree; 0= strongly agree

ElementDescription: I don't get upset too easily
Notes: 0= strongly disagree; 1= disagree; 2= neutral; 3= agree; 4= strongly agree

ElementDescription: I rarely count on good things happening to me
Notes: 4= strongly disagree; 3= disagree; 2= neutral; 1= agree; 0= strongly agree

ElementDescription: Overall, I expect more good things to happen to me than bad
Notes: 0= strongly disagree; 1= disagree; 2= neutral; 3= agree; 4= strongly agree
